intro: Heteropterys bicolor var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf heteropterys, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking bi-colored leaves, which typically feature a green upper surface and a reddish or purple underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, followed by velvety, woolly fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks.
